**Summon Lightning Spire** is a level 4 [Summoning](/Summonings "Summonings")/[Air](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") spell which summons a [lightning spire](/Lightning_spire "Lightning spire").

[Summoners](/Summoner "Summoner") begin with this spell in their libraries.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

An immobile lightning spire that shoots [bolts of electricity](/Electrical_Bolt "Electrical Bolt") will be summoned in a random location within two tiles of the caster. The location must be empty and not [deep water](/Deep_water "Deep water") or [lava](/Lava "Lava").

Spires' Electrical Bolts can pierce through enemies and will bounce from most [walls](/Wall "Wall") (potentially [hitting targets twice](/Doublezap "Doublezap")). Unlike the similar [Lightning Bolt](/Lightning_Bolt "Lightning Bolt") spell, the lightning spire's bolts are quiet and reasonably accurate.

Higher spell power increases the spire's [hit dice](/Hit_dice "Hit dice"), which increases its HP, accuracy, and damage. Lightning spire HD equals `<spell power> / 10` (minimum of 1).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

The construct lasts for around 18 turns; it does not depend on spell power.

There is a summon limit of 1; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out.

## Strategy

Lightning spires offer a fair bit of damage for its MP cost, at least for the early game. Unlike other low-level summons, it can shoot from a distance. One use of the spire is with [kiting](/Kiting "Kiting"): summon a spire, back away, and let the spire get free shots. Even if you can't kite, it's good for the damage/MP alone.

Electric bolts can [doublezap](/Doublezap "Doublezap") if they reflect off a [wall](/Wall "Wall"). If the spire isn't placed in a way that allows that to happen and you have MP to spare, you can summon a new one to try to place it somewhere better.

### Tips & Tricks

- Spires will avoid shooting allies, including you, unless they are resistant or invisible. Make sure to position yourself and your allies in a way that allows the spire to fire.
- Spires cannot see [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible"). If you're invisible, it will fire bolts right through you. Conversely, spires are useless against invisible enemies, unless there is a visible monster behind them.
- Like other summons, spires can be used to block line of fire, or to seal off a corridor when you need to retreat.
  - However, the random placement might mean that the spire blocks off *your* retreat path. You can attack it with ctrl-direction or **v** to make it dissipate instantly.
- Spires are immune to [electricity](/Electricity "Electricity"), [poison](/Poison "Poison"), and [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy"), so you can use spells of those elements without harming the spire.

## History

- Prior to around [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), allies weren't smart enough to stop their attacks before they'd hit you. So in this kind of position:

```
.....
.@y8.
.....
```

- The spire would not shoot, because it would hit you.

* Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), the spire was summoned to a targeted location instead of a random one. Before this change, Lightning Spire was often considered one of the best spells in the game.
* This spell was added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [spl-summoning.cc:847](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/spl-summoning.cc#L847) (0.30.1)
